title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create an object representing a book:
1. Create object with: title (string), author (string), pages (number), isRead (boolean)
2. Display the title
3. Change isRead to true
4. Add a new property 'rating' with a number 1-5
5. Display the entire object
instructions:
Create an object representing a book:
1. Create object with: title (string), author (string), pages (number), isRead (boolean)
2. Display the title
3. Change isRead to true
4. Add a new property 'rating' with a number 1-5
5. Display the entire object

hints.text: let book = {title: '...', author: '...', pages: 300, isRead: false};

commonMistakes.mistake: Using = instead of : for property values
commonMistakes.correction: Use colon for object properties: { title: 'Book' }

commonMistakes.mistake: Using quotes around property names unnecessarily
commonMistakes.consequence: Not an error, but makes code less readable.
commonMistakes.correction: Only quote keys with special characters: { 'my-key': value }
